text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSImagingReport

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSImagingReport 0..*EHDSDocument
Elements defined in Ancestors:header, presentedForm, header, knowledgeResources
Imaging report model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
header 1..1BaseImaging Report header
accessionNumber 0..1stringAccession number - an identifier, managed by the RIS at the local level, which usually uniquely identifies an imaging procedure request, and links it to imaging study(ies) and related imaging report(s). As it is prefixed by the registration authority it is a globally unique ID, usable both nationally and cross-border.
healthInsuranceAndPaymentInformation 0..*EHDSCoverageHealth insurance and payment information
intendedRecipient[x] 0..*Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, additional recipients might be identified by the ordering party, e.g. GP, other specialist), if applicable
intendedRecipientEHDSPatientEHDSPatient
intendedRecipientEHDSRelatedPersonEHDSRelatedPerson
intendedRecipientEHDSHealthProfessionalEHDSHealthProfessional
intendedRecipientEHDSOrganisationEHDSOrganisation
intendedRecipientEHDSDeviceEHDSDevice
knowledgeResources 0..0
body 0..1BaseImaging Report structured body
orderInformation 0..*BaseOrder Information (Imaging Result Report could respond to multiple orders).
orderId 1..*IdentifierIdentifier(s) of the imaging service order.
orderDateAndTime 0..1dateTimeDate and time of the order placement.
orderPlacer[x] 0..1The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.
orderPlacerEHDSHealthProfessionalEHDSHealthProfessional
orderPlacerEHDSOrganisationEHDSOrganisation
orderPlacerEHDSPatientEHDSPatient
orderReasonText 0..*stringAn explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in textual form.
orderReason[x] 0..*An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded form.
orderReasonEHDSConditionEHDSCondition
orderReasonEHDSObservationEHDSObservation
clinicalQuestion 0..1stringSpecification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the imaging investigation.
supportingInformation 0..1BaseAdditional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may affect service delivery or interpretation.
observation 0..*EHDSObservationClinical findings and other observations (e.g., height and weights of the patient).
condition 0..*EHDSConditionConditions that may influence the service or result interpretation.
medicationAdministration 0..*EHDSMedicationAdministrationMedication administered before ordering the service.
devices 0..*EHDSDeviceList of implants or devices that affect the course of the examination or its interpretation (e.g. metal implants).
pregnancyStatus 0..1CodeableConceptPregnancy status when the imaging examination was performed (e.g., pregnant, not pregnant, unknown).
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT
gestationalAge 0..1QuantityGestational age - duration of the pregnancy on the day on which the patient was asked or at the delivery. The duration can be given in weeks and/or days.
sexForClinicalUse 0..*CodeableConceptSex parameter for clinical use - provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population.
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 sex-parameter-for-clinical-use
otherSupportingInformation 0..*ResourceAny other type of relevant supporting information
specimen 0..*EHDSSpecimenSpecimen information. Note: A specimen (not attached to a body) can be used for diagnostic, forensic and medical research purposes.
serviceRequest 0..*EHDSServiceRequestSpecification of requested service(s).
exposureInformation 0..1BaseInformation on total exposure to ionising radiation. This information is required by regulations in several EU countries.
effectiveDose 0..*QuantityEffective dose - sum of equivalent doses to all organs, from external and/or internal exposures, each adjusted to account for the sensitivity of the organ to radiation. [mSv]
Binding Description: (preferred): UCUM (for units)
equivalentDoseInformation 1..1BaseEquivalent dose is based on the absorbed dose per organ, adjusted to account for the effectiveness of the type of radiation [mSv].
equivalentDose 1..1QuantityEquivalent dose is a measure of the radiation dose to tissue where an attempt has been made to allow for the different relative biological effects of different types of ionizing radiation. Equivalent dose is based on the absorbed dose per organ, adjusted to account for the effectiveness of the type of radiation [mSv].
Binding Description: (preferred): UCUM (for units)
tissueType 1..1CodeableConceptType of the tissue for which do dosage was enumerated.
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT
examinationReport 1..1BaseExamination report content.
modality 1..*CodeableConceptImaging modality (or modalities) used during imaging investigation (DICOM CID029).
Binding Description: (preferred): DICOM Modality
bodyPart 0..*EHDSBodyStructureAll body parts investigated
imagingProcedures 0..*EHDSProcedureImaging procedure performed during imaging study.
medication 0..*EHDSMedicationAdministrationInformation about medication administered (contrast, sedation, stress agents), etc.
adverseReaction 0..*EHDSAllergyIntoleranceAdverse reactions manifested during imaging investigation.
resultData 0..1BaseLaboratory report result data
resultText 1..1stringComments and narrative representation of the observation results and findings.
observationResults 0..*EHDSObservationObservation details (report could consist of multiple observations)
conclusion 1..1BaseA concise and clinically contextualised summary including interpretation/impression of the diagnostic report.
impression 1..1stringNarrative description of the clinical conclusion (impression).
conditionOrFinding[x] 0..*Condition or finding from imaging investigation.
conditionOrFindingEHDSConditionEHDSCondition
conditionOrFindingEHDSObservationEHDSObservation
recommendation 0..1BaseRecommendations for additional imaging tests or other actions
description 1..1stringNarrative description of the recommended activities including additional test, medication etc.
carePlan 0..*EHDSCarePlanA complex and structured information about recommended goals, activities and objectives in the form of one or more formal care plan.
comparisonStudy 0..*EHDSImagingReportDocumentation (reference) of a prior Imaging Report to which the current images were compared.
dicomStudyMetadata 0..*EHDSImagingStudyMetadata of the DICOM study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context. A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.
attachments[x] 0..*Report attachments data elements
attachmentsEHDSAttachmentEHDSAttachment
attachmentsEHDSMediaEHDSMedia

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSImagingReport
title: Imaging report model
description: EHDS refined base model for Medical Imaging Result Report

element.short: Imaging report model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for Medical Imaging Result Report

element.short: Imaging Report header
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data

element.short: Subject
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Document ID
element.definition: Unique identifier of the document

element.short: Authorship
element.definition: Resource authoring details

element.short: Author
element.definition: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

element.short: Date and time of authoring/issuing
element.definition: Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

element.short: Date and time of the last update to the resource
element.definition: Date and time of the last update to the document/information

element.short: Status of the resource
element.definition: Status of the resource

element.short: Reason for the current status of the resource.
element.definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.

element.short: Language
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: Version
element.definition: Business version of the resource.

element.short: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document
element.definition: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

element.short: Document type
element.definition: Identifies the type of document at hand, e.g. Discharge report.

element.short: Document title
element.definition: Document title, such as Discharge Report, Laboratory Result Report, etc.

element.short: Document status
element.definition: The status of the Discharge report. E.g., preliminary, final.

element.short: Period
element.definition: Time of service that is being documented

element.short: Attestation
element.definition: Document attestation details

element.short: Attester
element.definition: Attester who validated the document. Mulitple attesters could be provided.

element.short: DateTime
element.definition: Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester.

element.short: Legal authentication
element.definition: Document legal authentication

element.short: Legal authenticator
element.definition: The person taking responsibility for the medical content of the document

element.short: DateTime
element.definition: Date and time when the document was authorized.

element.short: Event type
element.definition: Categorization of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement betwen data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purpuses.

element.short: Specialty
element.definition: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

element.short: Document custodian
element.definition: Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.

element.short: Document format
element.definition: An identifier of the document constraints, encoding, structure, and template that the document conforms to beyond the base format indicated in the mimeType.

element.short: Confidentiality
element.definition: Level of confidentiality of the document. Implicit value is normal.

element.short: Related documents and information sources
element.definition: Related documents and information sources

element.short: Accession number - an identifier, managed by the RIS at the local level, which usually uniquely identifies an imaging procedure request, and links it to imaging study(ies) and related imaging report(s). As it is prefixed by the registration authority it is a globally unique ID, usable both nationally and cross-border.
element.definition: Accession number - an identifier, managed by the RIS at the local level, which usually uniquely identifies an imaging procedure request, and links it to imaging study(ies) and related imaging report(s). As it is prefixed by the registration authority it is a globally unique ID, usable both nationally and cross-border.

element.short: Health insurance and payment information
element.definition: Health insurance information is not always required, however, in some jurisdictions, the insurance number is also used as the patient identifier. It is necessary not just for identification but also forms access to funding for care.

element.short: Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, additional recipients might be identified by the ordering party, e.g. GP, other specialist), if applicable
element.definition: Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, additional recipients might be identified by the ordering party, e.g. GP, other specialist), if applicable

element.short: Imaging Report structured body
element.definition: Imaging Report structured body

element.definition: Order Information (Imaging Result Report could respond to multiple orders).

element.definition: Identifier(s) of the imaging service order.

element.short: Date and time of the order placement.
element.definition: Date and time of the order placement.

element.short: The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.
element.definition: The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.

element.short: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in textual form.

element.definition: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded form.

element.definition: Specification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the imaging investigation.

element.short: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may affect service delivery or interpretation.
element.definition: This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order.  For example, reporting the metal implants present in patient's body.

element.definition: Pregnancy status when the imaging examination was performed (e.g., pregnant, not pregnant, unknown).

element.short: A complex and structured information about recommended goals, activities and objectives in the form of one or more formal care plan.

element.short: Documentation (reference) of a prior Imaging Report to which the current images were compared.
element.definition: Documentation (reference) of a prior Imaging Report to which the current images were compared.

element.short: Metadata of the DICOM study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context. A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context. A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.
